metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000494 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Uninitialized stack variable vulnerability in NameValueParserEndElt(upnpreplyparse.c) in miniupnpd < 2.0 allows an attacker to cause Denial ofService (Segmentation fault and Memory Corruption) or possibly haveunspecified other impact

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libminiupnpc10 - 1.9.20140610-2ubuntu2.16.04.2
miniupnpc - 1.9.20140610-2ubuntu2.16.04.2
python-miniupnpc - 1.9.20140610-2ubuntu2.16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

miniupnpd - 1.8.20140523-4.1+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: miniupnpc package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.20140610-2ubuntu2.16.04.2').
miniupnpd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.20140523-4.1+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
